c74object.name: bach.idvector
c74object.description: Builds versors having all 0's as entries, except for a 1 in a given position (or combinations of such versors).

inlet.description: The index or indices corresponding to the 1's in the vector is expected in the first inlet

objarg.name: size
objarg.description: The length of the output vector (defaults to 1)

objarg.name: position-of-ones
objarg.description: The index or indices corresponding to the 1's in the vector can be listed as second argument (by default the 1st element of the vector is the 1).

method.name: bang
method.description: Builds the vector according to the most recently input data.

method.name: int
method.description:
An integer in the first inlet outputs the cartesian vector having all 0's and just a 1 in the position specified by the incoming index. For instance, if the incoming index is 2, and the length of the vector is 5, the vector will be 0 1 0 0 0. It also works with negative indices, as elsewhere in bach, indicating elements right-to-left (-1 being the last, -2 the one-but-last...).
An integer in the second inlet sets a new length of the vector.

method.name: list
method.description: A list in the first inlet is considered as a list of indices corresponding to 1's elements in the vector, while every other index is considered to be 0. As for the int case, negative indices are allowed indicating elements to be counted right-to-left (-1 being the last, -2 the one-but-last...). For instance, if the length of the vector is 5, a list of 2 -2 -1 will trigger the output of the vector 0 1 0 1 1.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

entry.name: Inlet 1 (int/list)
entry.description: Position(s) of the 1('s). The index or indices corresponding to the 1's in the vector is expected in the first inlet
